description: Inheritance is a concept in object-oriented programming where a new class (subclass) can inherit attributes and methods from an existing class (superclass). This allows for code reuse and the creation of a hierarchy of classes, where subclasses can specialize and extend the functionality of their superclass.
key_points: Inheritance: It's a concept in object-oriented programming.
Subclass and Superclass: Inheritance involves creating a new class (subclass) that can inherit attributes and methods from an existing class (superclass).
Code Reuse: Inheritance allows for reusing code from the superclass in the subclass.
Hierarchy: It enables the creation of a hierarchy of classes where subclasses can specialize and extend the functionality of their superclass.
